forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Cloudy, with a low around 51. South southeast wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5pm, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South wind 14 to 36 mph, with gusts as high as 54 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the clock ticks past two in the morning, Downtown San Francisco is cloaked in the low murmur of rain, evident in the cool air that brushes against the skin. For those stirred from slumber, the atmosphere is thick with a sense of impending change, as a mix of clouds and the occasional gust whispers of the storms yet to come. The rain likely to join the quiet symphony of drips will soon resonate more loudly, swelling to a robust rhythm by morning, with a promise of gatherings of droplets, from half an inch to three-quarters, later in the day. 

As the sun ventures closer to rising, the day will awaken not with golden rays but with muted shades of gray, the high hovering around fifty-seven, gently waning to about fifty-two by afternoon. A formidable wind from the south will add to the drama, with its gusts competing for attention, potentially reaching as fierce as fifty-four miles per hour—each breath a reminder of nature's relentless power. If the city’s character is to shine today, it will be dressed in layers; those stepping outside might opt for a solid, windbreaker jacket, perhaps over a cozy sweater, completed with sturdy shoes made for slippery sidewalks. Ideal for braving this weather, it may be the day for quiet coffee ceremonies or perhaps wandering through the aisles of a local bookstore, giving refuge against the stormy embrace outside. As rain begins to weave its way into the day, take a moment to appreciate the tranquility of it all—a time for thinking, reading, or simply enjoying the cadence of life drawn close under a warm roof until the sky clears once more.
